newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: No immediate job cuts seen at Vaal Reefs.
newsitem.headline: No immediate job cuts seen at Vaal Reefs.

text.p: Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd said on Thursday it had no immediate plans to cut jobs at its Vaal Reefs Exploration and Mining Co unit.
"No retrenchments are immediately contemplated although some redeployment of employees at No 3 shaft is likely," Anglo said.
Earlier Vaal Reefs mine manager David Fisher had said the mine would have to make major job cuts.
"We will have to investigate compulsory retrenchments...we will have to make fairly significant reductions," Fisher said a presentation.
Anglo said that if productivity could be improved, retrenchment would not be necessary.
Vaal Reefs produced 16,022 kg of gold in the three months to end-March.
